reason:
QED STATEMENT INHERITS AND PROPAGATES THE FUNDAMENTAL F_O COLLAPSE ERROR.

The QED restates the conclusion: "characterize O-slice >= n connectivity by the geometric fixed point condition Phi^H >= floor(n/|H|)-connected for all H in F_O."

This statement propagates the foundational error from node 1.1: F_O = Sub(G) for EVERY transfer system O. As a consequence, the QED's claimed theorem is:

"A connective G-spectrum X is O-slice >= n iff for every H <= G, Phi^H(X) is floor(n/|H|)-connected."

Since the O-slice cells are also O-independent (all transfer systems give the same cells because F_O = Sub(G) always), the left-hand side "O-slice >= n" is also O-independent. The entire theorem reduces to:

"A connective G-spectrum X is regular-slice >= n iff for every H <= G, Phi^H(X) is floor(n/|H|)-connected."

This is (up to the off-by-one issue in node 1.6) precisely HHR Theorem 4.42, the standard Regular Slice Theorem. The proof tree has not established anything NEW about incomplete transfer systems. The "O-" prefix throughout the entire proof tree is vacuous decoration that adds no mathematical content.

For the QED to claim a genuine generalization, the F_O definition must first be fixed so that different transfer systems O produce genuinely different families F_O, different slice cells, and different filtrations. Until then, the QED is at best a restatement of existing theory, not a new result.
